instructions.name: buy_tokens
docs: Buy tokens using the pump.fun bonding curve with Pyth price integration

accounts.name: kol_master
docs: Optional master KOL allocation for buyer (unchecked; only read if valid)

accounts.name: platform_vault
docs: PDA vault to collect platform fees (pre-initialized during factory init)

accounts.name: price_cache
docs: Price cache PDA storing last SOL/USD price

instructions.name: calculate_sol_for_tokens
docs: VIEW FUNCTION: Calculate SOL received for token input (read-only)
Frontend can call this to preview sell transactions

docs: Public user data for tracking user's total SOL spent (optional for UI calculations)

accounts.name: price_cache
docs: Price cache PDA storing last SOL/USD price

instructions.name: calculate_tokens_for_sol
docs: VIEW FUNCTION: Calculate tokens received for SOL input (read-only)
Frontend can call this to preview buy transactions

accounts.name: price_cache
docs: Price cache PDA storing last SOL/USD price

instructions.name: close_factory
docs: Close the factory configuration and platform vault PDAs (admin only)
After this, you can re-run initialize_factory.

instructions.name: create_token_sale
docs: Create a new token sale with pump.fun bonding curve mechanics
Users call this to launch their own tokens with metadata

accounts.name: price_cache
docs: Price cache PDA storing last SOL/USD price

instructions.name: estimate_dev_tokens_for_sol
docs: VIEW FUNCTION: Estimate dev tokens for SOL input before token creation
Uses the initial virtual AMM state and applies no fees (dev creation path)

instructions.name: estimate_tokens_for_sol_amount
docs: COMPREHENSIVE VIEW FUNCTION: Estimate tokens received for SOL input
Handles both existing tokens and new token creation scenarios
Returns detailed estimation including fees and pricing information

accounts.name: token_mint
docs: Token mint to estimate for (can be uninitialized for new tokens)

accounts.name: sale_config
docs: Sale configuration account (optional - only needed for existing tokens)
For new tokens, this will be None

accounts.name: price_cache
docs: Price cache PDA storing last SOL/USD price

instructions.name: get_allocations
docs: VIEW FUNCTION: Get allocation summary for a given user and mint

accounts.name: kol_data
docs: Optional KOL data account for this user and mint (may be uninitialized)

accounts.name: kol_master
docs: Optional master KOL data for the user (unchecked; validated at runtime)

accounts.name: public_user_data
docs: Optional Public user data account for per-user SOL cap tracking
Use UncheckedAccount so callers may pass the PDA even if not yet initialized.
We'll safely read it only if it exists and is owned by this program.

instructions.name: initialize_factory
docs: Initialize the token factory with platform configuration
Called once during deployment by Yappr organization

instructions.name: refresh_price
docs: Refresh the cached SOL/USD price using a Pyth PriceUpdateV2 account

instructions.name: sell_tokens
docs: Sell tokens back to the bonding curve

accounts.name: platform_vault
docs: PDA vault to collect platform fees (pre-initialized during factory init)

accounts.name: price_cache
docs: Price cache PDA storing last SOL/USD price

instructions.name: set_phase
docs: Set the current phase of the token sale (KOL, Public)

instructions.name: update_kol_allocation
docs: Update master KOL allocation after verifying backend signature

accounts.name: factory_config
docs: Global factory config provides backend authority

instructions.name: update_migration_threshold
docs: Update the migration threshold for a token sale (admin function)

instructions.name: update_price_mode
docs: strict_mode: true = no fallbacks, false = use fallback pricing

instructions.name: withdraw_platform_fees
docs: Withdraw accumulated platform fees from PDA vault to configured platform wallet

instructions.name: withdraw_to_migration
docs: Withdraw tokens (mint to destination) and lamports from sale to migration vaults (admin-only)

errors.name: Unauthorized
errors.msg: Unauthorized action - caller does not have required permissions

errors.name: InvalidBackendSignature
errors.msg: Invalid backend signature for KOL operation

errors.name: KolDataNotFound
errors.msg: KOL data not found for this phase

errors.name: InvalidTokenAmount
errors.msg: Invalid token amount - must be greater than zero

errors.name: InvalidTokenInfo
errors.msg: Invalid token name or symbol - check length requirements

errors.name: InvalidMetadataUri
errors.msg: Invalid metadata URI - must be valid URL format

errors.name: InvalidMetadataAccount
errors.msg: Invalid metadata account - Metaplex validation failed

errors.name: CapExceeded
errors.msg: Cap exceeded - operation would exceed allocation limits

errors.name: AllocationTooLarge
errors.msg: The specified allocation is too large for this KOL

errors.name: ExceedsMigrationCap
errors.msg: Transaction would exceed migration threshold maximum ($100k)

errors.name: AlreadyMigrated
errors.msg: Tokens have already been migrated to AMM

errors.name: InvalidPhase
errors.msg: Operation not allowed in current phase

errors.name: MigrationNotReady
errors.msg: Migration not ready - threshold not reached

errors.name: StalePriceFeed
errors.msg: Price feed data is stale or outdated

errors.name: EmptyPriceFeed
errors.msg: Price feed account is empty or too small

errors.name: InvalidPrice
errors.msg: Price feed returned invalid or negative price

errors.name: Underflow
errors.msg: Result underflow - calculation would result in negative value

errors.name: InvalidMigrationThreshold
errors.msg: Invalid migration threshold - must be greater than zero

errors.name: InvalidCurveProgress
errors.msg: Invalid curve progress - must be between 0 and 1

errors.name: TooManyIterations
errors.msg: Too many iterations in token calculation

types.name: FactoryConfig
docs: Factory configuration account - global settings for all token sales

types.name: KolMasterData
docs: Master KOL allocation data (per KOL, global across all mints)

types.name: Phase
docs: Enum to represent the different phases of the token sale

types.name: PlatformVault
docs: Program-owned vault to accumulate platform fees, withdrawable by authority

types.name: PriceCache
docs: Cached SOL/USD price updated via a keeper using Pyth PriceUpdateV2

fields.name: feed_id
docs: `FeedId` but avoid the type alias because of compatibility issues with Anchor's `idl-build` feature.

fields.name: publish_time
docs: The timestamp of this price update in seconds

fields.name: prev_publish_time
docs: The timestamp of the previous price update. This field is intended to allow users to
identify the single unique price update for any moment in time:
for any time t, the unique update is the one such that prev_publish_time < t <= publish_time.
Note that there may not be such an update while we are migrating to the new message-sending logic,
as some price updates on pythnet may not be sent to other chains (because the message-sending
logic may not have triggered). We can solve this problem by making the message-sending mandatory
(which we can do once publishers have migrated over).
Additionally, this field may be equal to publish_time if the message is sent on a slot where
where the aggregation was unsuccesful. This problem will go away once all publishers have
migrated over to a recent version of pyth-agent.

fields.name: price_feed_account
docs: Price feed account that caused the issue

types.name: PriceUpdateV2
docs: A price update account. This account is used by the Pyth Receiver program to store a verified price update from a Pyth price feed.
- `write_authority`: The write authority for this account. This authority can close this account to reclaim rent or update the account to contain a different price update.
- `verification_level`: The [`VerificationLevel`] of this price update. This represents how many Wormhole guardian signatures have been verified for this price update.
- `posted_slot`: The slot at which this price update was posted.

types.name: PublicUserData
docs: Public phase user purchase tracking data

types.name: SaleConfig
docs: Configuration for individual token sales with pump.fun bonding curve mechanics

fields.name: dev_wallet
docs: Developer wallet that created the token

types.name: TokenEstimation
docs: Comprehensive token estimation result for SOL input

fields.name: total_tokens_sold
docs: Total tokens sold after this transaction

fields.name: total_usd_raised
docs: Total USD raised after this transaction

types.name: VerificationLevel
docs: Pyth price updates are bridged to all blockchains via Wormhole.
Using the price updates on another chain requires verifying the signatures of the Wormhole guardians.
The usual process is to check the signatures for two thirds of the total number of guardians, but this can be cumbersome on Solana because of the transaction size limits,
so we also allow for partial verification.
This enum represents how much a price update has been verified:
- If `Full`, we have verified the signatures for two thirds of the current guardians.
- If `Partial`, only `num_signatures` guardian signatures have been checked.
Using partially verified price updates is dangerous, as it lowers the threshold of guardians that need to collude to produce a malicious price update.
